Description: Shoulder sherd (mended from five fragments) of South Ionian pottery amphora; handle root on shoulder at right break. Exterior: black band at turn to neck; on reserved shoulder, part of three dot rosettes; below, black line and black band; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: It is possible that a Samian made a dedication to Apollo Milesios, but prima facie unlikely.
The sherd was analysed with NAA by H. Mommsen (Bonn), (see Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006, p. 56, Table). Sample Nauk 84 was identified as a chemical singleton.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 2)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 642, no. 4)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (176)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p.56 Table 1)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 157-8, NAU130, pl. 28h-i)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.004)
